alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds containing a sulfanilide moiety, with the general structure RS(=O)(=O)NC1=CC=CC=C1.
alternative_parents.name: Sulfanilides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a sulfonic acid or a derivative thereof that is linked to a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Benzenesulfonic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: An arylsulfonic acid carrying the sulfonic acid group at the 1-position, and no substitute at the 2-position of the aromatic ring.
alternative_parents.name: 1-sulfo,2-unsubstituted aromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing a benzenesulfonyl group, which consists of a monocyclic benzene moiety that carries a sulfonyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Benzenesulfonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Heteropolycyclic compounds with a structure containing isoindole, a benzo-fused pyrrole.
alternative_parents.name: Isoindoles

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonamide functional group, an amide of sulfonic acid with the general structure R1S(=O)2N(R2)R3 (R1=alkyl, aryl; R2,R3=H, alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonamides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrrole ring, which is a five-member aromatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrroles

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonic acid group, which has the general structure RS(=O)2OH (R is not a hydrogen atom).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds with the general formula RS(=O)(=O)N(R')R''  (R = organyl, R'-R\" = any atom but N).
alternative_parents.name: Aminosulfonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a transition metal atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic transition metal salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with a positive electric charge.
alternative_parents.name: Organic cations

class.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing four pyrrole rings joined by one-carbon units linking position 2 of one pyrrole ring to position 5 of the next.
class.name: Tetrapyrroles and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phthalocyanines. These are cyclic tetrapyrroles that contain a phthalocyanine skeleton, which consists of four isoindole-type units, with the connecting carbon atoms in the macrocycle replaced by nitrogen.

direct_parent.description: Cyclic tetrapyrroles that contain a phthalocyanine skeleton, which consists of four isoindole-type units, with the connecting carbon atoms in the macrocycle replaced by nitrogen.
direct_parent.name: Phthalocyanines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Cyclic tetrapyrroles that contain a phthalocyanine skeleton, which consists of four isoindole-type units, with the connecting carbon atoms in the macrocycle replaced by nitrogen.
subclass.name: Phthalocyanines

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
